CatDescriptText: Mr. Fred Richardson, 517 Grace Street, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Which do you think people give priority recognition to, the acquisition of money or achievement?" answer reads: "As for praise and recognition of the man of achievement, other than acquiring money, that recognition is just a passing fantasy of hero worship. Over a period of time, the man who has the money will be remembered the longer."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Fred Richardson, wearing light colored button down coat, dark necktie, and dark hat and band, standing in front of multicolor flecked stone wall
